abstract.t: The Internationalizing Domain Names in Applications (IDNA)specification describes how to process domain names that containcharacters outside the ASCII repertoire. A user who has a non-ASCIIdomain name may want to use it in an Internet mail address thatcontains non-ASCII characters not only in the domain part but alsoin the local part (the part to the left of the '@'). This documentdescribes how to use non-ASCII characters in local parts. Itdefines internationalized local parts (ILPs), internationalized mailaddresses (IMAs), and a mechanism called IMAA for handling them in astandard fashion.
